skill.name: modal
skill.description: Run Python code in the cloud with serverless containers, GPUs, and autoscaling. Use when deploying ML models, running batch processing jobs, scheduling compute-intensive tasks, or serving APIs that require GPU acceleration or dynamic scaling.
skill.summary: Run Python code in the cloud with serverless containers, GPUs, and autoscaling. Use when deploying M...
skill.author: K-Dense-AI

security_audit.summary: This is a documentation skill for Modal, a legitimate cloud computing platform. All 563 static findings are FALSE POSITIVES. The scanned files are Markdown documentation containing Python code examples. The scanner misinterprets documentation code blocks and legitimate Modal API patterns as security issues. No executable code, malicious patterns, or credential exfiltration exists in this skill.

content.user_title: Run Python in the cloud with GPUs and autoscaling
content.value_statement: Deploy Python functions to serverless cloud containers with automatic GPU allocation and horizontal scaling. Ideal for ML inference, batch data processing, and scheduled computational tasks without managing infrastructure.
actual_capabilities: Deploy Python functions to serverless cloud containers with GPU support
Automatically scale from zero to thousands of parallel containers
Schedule cron jobs and periodic tasks for background processing
Manage secrets and environment variables securely across functions
Mount persistent volumes for model storage and data caching
Serve web endpoints and APIs with automatic HTTPS certificates
limitations: Requires Modal account and API token authentication
Limited to Python workloads (other languages not supported)
Cold start latency may affect interactive applications
Functions must complete within configured timeout (default 5 minutes)

use_cases.title: Deploy ML Models
use_cases.description: Serve PyTorch or TensorFlow models on H100 GPUs with automatic scaling for production inference workloads.

use_cases.title: Batch Processing
use_cases.description: Process large datasets in parallel across multiple containers with CPU or GPU acceleration on demand.

use_cases.title: Scheduled Compute Jobs
use_cases.description: Run training pipelines, data collection, or simulations on schedules without managing compute infrastructure.

prompt_templates.title: Basic GPU Function
prompt_templates.prompt: Deploy a Python function that runs on an A100 GPU to perform image classification using a pretrained model.

prompt_templates.title: Batch Processing
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a function that processes CSV files in parallel across multiple containers, saving results to a shared volume.

prompt_templates.title: Web API
prompt_templates.prompt: Build a web endpoint that accepts JSON requests, runs inference on a GPU, and returns predictions with proper error handling.

prompt_templates.title: Scheduled Pipeline
prompt_templates.prompt: Set up a scheduled function that runs daily at 2 AM to refresh cached data, using secrets for API authentication.

output_examples.input: Deploy a GPU function to run Stable Diffusion for image generation
output: âœ“ Function configured with L40S GPU and 16GB memory

best_practices: Pin package versions in uv_pip_install for reproducible builds across deployments
Use volumes to cache model weights and datasets rather than rebuilding them each run
Attach secrets only to functions that need them to minimize credential exposure
anti_patterns: Avoid hardcoding API keys in image environment variables - use Modal Secrets instead
Do not process files sequentially when .map() enables easy parallelization
Avoidé•¿æ—¶é—´è¿è¡Œè¶…è¿‡timeouté™åˆ¶ - break into smaller tasks with checkpointing

faq.question: How much does Modal cost?
faq.answer: Pay per second of compute. GPU instances from $0.0009/second. $30 free credits monthly for new accounts.

faq.question: What GPU types are available?
faq.answer: T4, L4, A10, A100 (40GB/80GB), L40S, H100, H200, and B200. Multi-GPU support up to 8 cards.

faq.question: How do I authenticate?
faq.answer: Run 'modal token new' to authenticate via browser. Credentials stored in ~/.modal.toml automatically.

faq.question: Can I run existing Docker images?
faq.answer: Yes. Use modal.Image.from_registry() to pull from Docker Hub or private registries with authentication.

faq.question: How does autoscaling work?
faq.answer: Modal scales from zero to configured max_containers automatically. No containers run when idle - no charges.

faq.question: What Python versions are supported?
faq.answer: Python 3.8 through 3.12. Recommend 3.11 or 3.12 for best performance with modern packages.
